name: b2a8e9c3-392a-42fc-9b21-8b819fcb7316
displayName: Failed import alerts on the Dashboard page

text.text: What are the facility matching and updating rules during NEMSIS file import in ZOLL Billing?

text: It is your responsibility to ensure that duplicate facilities are not included in the import file. Failure to change facility information may result in the creation of duplicate facilities.

text.text: Can you explain how ZOLL Billing attempts to match facilities during NEMSIS file import?

text: The system looks at the eRecord.01 value in the NEMSIS file to determine if the file has been previously imported. If it has never seen this value before, a claim is created.

text.text: What happens if there is a single exact match for the NPI or state ID during NEMSIS file import in ZOLL Billing?

text: If there is a single exact match for the NPI or state ID, the facility is matched.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle facility selection when there is no single exact match in the NEMSIS file?

text: If there are multiple facility name matches, then ZOLL Billing will prompt you to select the facility using the Select button.

text.text: What action does ZOLL Billing take if the user selects a different facility during NEMSIS file import?

text: If the user selects a different facility during NEMSIS file import, ZOLL Billing will create a new claim.

text.text: Is it possible for ZOLL Billing to remove the state ID from a facility during NEMSIS file import?

text: ZOLL Billing does not remove the state ID from a facility during NEMSIS file import.

text.text: What does ZOLL Billing do if there is no match for the NPI or state ID during NEMSIS file import?

text: If there are multiple state IDs or if there is no exact state ID match, then ZOLL Billing will look at the NPI. If there are multiple NPI matches or there is no exact NPI match, then ZOLL Billing will look at address line 1.

text.text: Can you describe how ZOLL Billing recommends a facility during NEMSIS file import?

text: ZOLL Billing recommends a facility based on the following criteria: NPI, state ID, address line 1. If there are multiple state IDs or if there is no exact state ID match, then ZOLL Billing will look at the NPI. If there are multiple NPI matches or there is no exact NPI match, then ZOLL Billing will look at address line 1.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing update the state ID or NPI of a facility during NEMSIS file import?

text: ZOLL Billing does not update the state ID or NPI of a facility during NEMSIS file import.

text.text: Can you clarify the process of selecting and updating facilities in ZOLL Billing during NEMSIS file import?

text: To select and update facilities in ZOLL Billing during NEMSIS file import, you can use the following steps: 1. On the navigation bar, click Admin 2. Click the Billing tile 3. Click the Facilities tile 4. You will see a list of configured facilities 5. Click on a facility name to modify the facility information 6. If you don't see a facility on the list, click Add a facility.

text.text: Are there any specific criteria for ZOLL Billing to automatically select a facility during NEMSIS file import?

text: ZOLL Billing does not automatically select a facility during NEMSIS file import.

text.text: What actions can users take if the selected facility during NEMSIS file import is incorrect?

text: If the selected facility during NEMSIS file import is incorrect, users can: Export a facility list, then import it back into ZOLL Billing. Users can also add or find facilities in Admin.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle the address display if there is no single exact match for facilities during NEMSIS file import?

text: If there are multiple NPI matches or there is no exact NPI match, ZOLL Billing looks at address line 1. If there are multiple matches on the state and city on address line 1 or there is no exact address match, ZOLL Billing looks at the facility name.

text.text: What considerations should users keep in mind when selecting facilities in ZOLL Billing during NEMSIS file import?

text: If you use the exported file to import facilities back into ZOLL Billing, be sure and change facility information before the import. Failure to change facility information may result in the creation of duplicate facilities.

text.text: Can you provide a summary of the facility matching and updating rules applied during NEMSIS file import in ZOLL Billing?

text: The system looks at the eRecord.01 value in the NEMSIS file to determine if the file has been previously imported.

text.text: what is facility matching/updating rules apply when importing a NEMSIS file

text: If this value is not unique (this file was already imported) then a message displays on the Import Claims page that reads "Not imported: duplicate of existing claim".

text.text: Facility Matching/Updating Rules During NEMSIS Import

text: The algorithm for matching facilities on the Transport Details tab during claim creation for both the Origin and Destination locations, is as follows (in order of importance): State ID: If there are multiple state IDs or if there is no exact state ID match, then we look at the NPI. NPI: If there are multiple NPI matches or there is no exact NPI match, then we look at address line 1. Address line 1 - state and city: If there are multiple matches on the state and city on address line 1 or there is no exact address match, then we look at the facility name. Facility name: If there are multiple facility name matches, then we will prompt you to select the facility using the Select button.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing alert users to import-related issues on the Dashboard?

text: The Dashboard will let you know how many unassigned incomplete claims there are in the system. If you see a zero amount accompanied by a happy face, you can relax. If you see a number accompanied by a Work button, it's time to get those incomplete claims done.

text.text: Can you explain the purpose of the clickable warning messages in the upper left corner of the Dashboard in ZOLL Billing?

text: When a NEMSIS or batch import fails, there is a clickable warning message that displays in the upper left corner of the Dashboard.

text.text: What actions should users take when they see a NEMSIS import issue alert on the Dashboard?

text: If you see a NEMSIS import issue alert on the Dashboard, you should click on the link to view the details of the error. You can then take the appropriate steps to resolve the issue.

text.text: How can users access the Imported Claims page from the Dashboard to address import-related problems?

text: To access the Imported Claims page, you can hover over Claims on the navigation bar and then click "Imported Claims". You can also click the "Incomplete claim" button on the Dashboard.

text.text: What filters are available on the Imported Claims page to help users focus on failed imports that need attention?

text:
The Imported Claims page has a number of filters that can be used to focus on failed imports that need attention. These filters include:

* Import Status: This filter allows users to view all imported claims, or to filter by the status of the import. The status options are:
    * Imported: Claims that have been successfully imported.
    * Not Imported: Claims that failed to import.
    * Incomplete: Claims that were imported, but have not been assigned to a user.
* Import Type: This filter allows users to view all imported claims, or to filter by the type of import. The import type options are:
    * NEMSIS: Claims imported from a NEMSIS file.
    * Batch: Claims imported from a batch file.
* Import Date: This filter allows users to view all imported claims, or to filter by the date of the import.
* Facility: This filter allows users to view all imported claims

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing indicate unresolved import issues within a bulk remittance import on the Dashboard?

text: ZOLL Billing indicates unresolved import issues within a bulk remittance import on the Dashboard by showing a number next to the "Incomplete - Verify patient account" button. The number indicates how many records match the criteria for the import.

text.text: Can you describe the process of accessing the Remittance Batch Status page from the Dashboard to address bulk remittance import issues?

text: To access the Remittance Batch Status page, you can hover over Remittances on the navigation bar and then click "Remittance Batch Status".

text.text: What filters are available on the Remittance Batch Status page to help users focus on unresolved import issues?

text:
The Remittance Batch Status page has a number of filters that can be used to focus on unresolved import issues. These filters include:

* Import Status: This filter allows users to view all imported remittances, or to filter by the status of the import. The status options are:
    * Imported: Remittances that have been successfully imported.
    * Not Imported: Remittances that failed to import.
    * Incomplete: Remittances that were imported, but have not been assigned to a user.
* Import Type: This filter allows users to view all imported remittances, or to filter by the type of import. The import type options are:
    * Bulk: Remittances imported from a bulk file.
    * Individual: Remittances imported from an individual file.
* Import Date: This filter allows users to view all imported remittances, or to filter by the date of the import.
* Facility: This filter allows users

text.text: What action should users take once they have addressed the import issues related to NEMSIS or bulk remittance imports?

text: Once users have addressed the import issues, they should click the "Work" button to view a list of matching patient records. If the imported claim is a duplicate of an existing claim, click "Yes, merge this claim". If it is not, click "No, create a new claim".

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing indicate that all import issues have been resolved on the Dashboard?

text: The Dashboard will let you know how many unassigned incomplete claims there are in the system. If you see a zero amount accompanied by a happy face, you can relax. If you see a number accompanied by a Work button, it's time to get those incomplete claims done.

text.text: Is there any automatic removal of import issue alerts on the Dashboard once all issues are resolved?

text: When a NEMSIS or batch import fails, there is a clickable warning message that displays in the upper left corner of the Dashboard. There is no automatic removal of import issue alerts on the Dashboard once all issues are resolved.

text.text: Can you provide a summary of the steps users should take to address import-related issues alerted on the Dashboard in ZOLL Billing?

text: Imported PCRs come into ZOLL Billing as incomplete claims. You can view all incomplete claims on the Dashboard. To work an imported claim, click the "Work" button associated with the incomplete claims. If you see TBD in the "Claim #" column, it means that the import was successful but the system was unable to verify the patient account.

text.text: Are there any specific procedures users should follow when resolving NEMSIS import issues compared to bulk remittance import issues?

text: When a NEMSIS or batch import fails, there is a clickable warning message that displays in the upper left corner of the Dashboard.

text.text: How often do import-related issue alerts appear on the Dashboard in ZOLL Billing?

text: There are several ways to bring claims into ZOLL Billing; import a NEMSIS file, import PCRs through the Billing API, or manually create a claim. The Dashboard will let you know how many unassigned incomplete claims there are in the system. If you see a number accompanied by a Work button, it's time to get those incomplete claims done.

text.text: Is there a way for users to manually dismiss import issue alerts on the Dashboard in ZOLL Billing?

text: There is no way for users to manually dismiss import issue alerts on the Dashboard in ZOLL Billing.

text.text: Failed Import Alerts on the Dashboard

text: When a NEMSIS or batch import fails, there is a clickable warning message that displays in the upper left corner of the Dashboard. To work an imported claim, click the claim number under the "Claim #" column. If you see TBD in that column, it means that the import was successful but the system was unable to verify the patient account. If there are issues with the patient on the imported claim, the imported claim will display in the "Incomplete - Verify patient account" button on the Dashboard.

text.text: NEMSIS import issues

text: When a NEMSIS or batch import fails, there is a clickable warning message that displays in the upper left corner of the Dashboard.

text.text: Bulk remittance import issues

text: When a NEMSIS or batch import fails, there is a clickable warning message that displays in the upper left corner of the Dashboard.

text.text: what all can in find in Remittance Batch Status page?

text: In the Remittance Batch Status page, you can find the following information: Whether the remittance batch is imported or not. Whether the remittance batch is posted or not.
